title.rendered: Movistar has already published the new roaming conditions from July 2022

content.rendered:
At the end of last year, the European Commission announced a renewal of the roaming agreement which ended on June 30, 2022. The new regulation will extend the current system until 2032, according to which citizens cannot be subject to surcharges for calls or data used while traveling within the European Union, and will also provide new advantages.

Movistar has decided to anticipate that moment and is already applying the new conditions of this renewed European roaming.

New Movistar roaming conditions

The new roaming regulations sets lower wholesale rates. These are costs charged by local mobile operators in exchange for access to their networks, so that visiting mobile operators and their customers benefit from roaming abroad.

European roaming

Wholesale caps are set at levels that ensure operators can maintain and recover the cost of providing roaming services to consumers.

For data services, the new regulation establishes the following wholesale limits: €2/GB in 2022, €1.8/GB in 2023, €1.55/GB in 2024, €1.3/GB in 2025 , 1.1 euros/GB in 2026 and 1 euro/GB from 2027 onwards. For voice telephony: 0.022 euros/min in 2022-2024 and 0.019 euros/min from 2025 onwards. SMS: €0.004/SMS in 2022-2024 and €0.003/SMS from 2025 onwards.

If we look at the roaming conditions on the Movistar website, we will see that they already reflect the new conditions that will come into force from July 1, 2022:

«In the case of having a rate with unlimited Data, the Roaming Data included in the EU, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway and the United Kingdom is 50 GB. Once the 50 GB is exceeded, the price of each MB will be €0.0029/MB (VAT included). In the case of having the Shared Data service, the conditions of use will be the same as in the national one, that is, once the sum of the data franchises of mobile lines in Shared Data has been exhausted, the client will be able to continue browsing at reduced speed without additional cost. As of July 1, 2022, the price per MB will be €0.0021/MB (VAT included).

Benefits of “roaming like at home”

Citizens will be able to call, send text messages and use mobile data when traveling within the EU at no additional cost and with the same quality as in their country; they will have better access to emergency communications, no matter where they are in Europe, and they will be entitled to clear information when a service they use while roaming may incur inadvertent additional costs.

Roaming European Union

Consumers will also benefit from access to roaming services when travelling, with the same quality as when using them at home. Consumers who usually have 5G services in their country will also be able to enjoy 5G roaming services.

Free roaming in the EU was introduced in 2017. In the latest Eurobarometer in February 2021, 33% of respondents who traveled abroad had lower mobile internet speeds than they typically do in their country, and 28% had a lower network standard abroad (ie, for example a 3G network instead of the 4G they were used to).
